English: What a rush! What a workout!
Chinese:
嗚哇──！　啊──好盡興啊！
充分的活動筋骨了呢。
Korean:
으햐하――! 아~ 즐거웠다!
적당한 운동이 되었네요
German: Wie spannend! Was für ein Workout!

English:
Those are some great Digimon you have there. As
promised, you've earned a 50% discount! How much
would you like?
Chinese:
這位客人，你有很棒的數碼寶貝呢。
那按照約定就給您半價優惠！
您要多少的量呢？
Korean:
손님, 좋은 디지몬을 가지고 계시군요.
그러면 약속한 대로 반액에 드리겠습니다!
중량은 어느 정도로 하시겠습니까?
German:
Das sind ja tolle Digimon, die du da hast. Wie
versprochen gibt’s 50 % Rabatt! Wie viel hättest
du gerne?

English:
Two kilograms. For Mirei Mikagura's consultation
room in Nakano.
Chinese:
2kg喔。
請送到中野的「御神樂米蕾諮商」喔。
German:
Zwei Kilo. An Mirei Mikaguras Beratungsraum in
Nakano.

English: It will be delivered in three or four days.
German: Wird in drei bis vier Tagen geliefert.

English: Hehe, thank you. I can't wait to see the quality.
Chinese:
呵呵，麻煩了。
我很期待……你們會讓我見識到什麼樣的上等貨。
Korean:
후후, 잘 부탁해.
당신들이 보여줄 극상의 맛……기대하고 있을게
German:
Hihi, danke. Ich freue mich schon darauf, die
Qualität in Augenschein zu nehmen.

English:
Nobody's ever bought that much. What will she do
with it?
Chinese:
哎呀，還沒見過有人一次訂購了2kg這麼多。
到底要拿來做什麼啊？
Korean:
이야아, 2kg을 요구하는 분은 보기 드물어요.
대체 어디에 쓰는 건가요?
German:
So viel hat noch nie jemand gekauft. Was hat sie
denn damit vor?
